result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Timothy Bantley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>10,000 g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Court notes 45 days credit against ultimate sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Defendant to maintain employment or education.
-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Tyler Timothy Bantley appeared. Case called at 10:11. Atty. Nelson updates the court, we are going to proceed to sentencing today. DE will not be withdrawing his plea today. ADA Minser responds. Court addresses DE and questions DE on his choice to proceed today. Court goes over options with DE. ADA Minser makes sentencing recommendations. Court addresses Atty. Neslon's filings from Oct. 30, they have been reviewed and will be added to the court file. Atty. Nelson makes sentencing argument. ADA Minser responds. DE makes statement. DE has completed assessment and is participating in after care treatment. 
Court orders: Sentence Imposed and STAYED
7 total confinement
3 years initial confinement,    
4 years extended supervision
- 45 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 

Court orders 6 years probation with conditions:
4 months in St. Croix County Jail as a condition
   Huber granted. 
- DE to commence jail time within the next 90 days to be arranged through the agent.  
- DE to maintain employment or education.
 -  Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia or what the agent deems appropriate. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Random and regular testing.
- 60 hours community service. 
- Costs
- $2500.00 exclusive of costs.
  Apply bond on file. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

DE to report to probation today.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Tyler Timothy Bantley appeared. Case called at 3:42. Atty. Nelson updates the court. Atty. Minser agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 14CF524 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 14CF524. Atty Nelson requests to hold off on the states requests of PSI pending the receipt of his personal PSI that is presently being completed. Sentencing arguments. Court orders the DOC to complete a PSI and Compass assessment. Bond continues, DE not revoked. Court modifies testing on Sept. 5th to Sept. 4, 2015 before 7 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial at 08-27-2015 03:30 pm

Nelson is not prepared for Plea Hearing today and updates Court. Atty. Nelson requests a new date. Court takes judicial notice of transfer of file within DA Office. ADA Hartung confirms he will be prosecutor on record. Address confirmed, bond continues. Adjourned 3:56 p.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 27, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

**Amended**

Bond on file

Co- signature bond of $10,000.00
Bond is to be Co-Signed by         SURETY NAME: Jill and Jason Morrow.

- Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your    possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Check in with the St. Croix County Jail to confirm address every Wednesday and Saturday.
- No contact with Mr. Albert and CI. 
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.  
- Report  before 8 :00pm every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
- DE will test by 7:00pm March 20, 2015  and tested again on March 23, 2015 after hearing. 
- Maintain residence with parents. Jill Morrow and Jason Morrow. 
- DE to be in the presence of his parents at all times except for traveling to and from work and during work hours. 
- Copy of work schedule along with telephone and address of employer to the DA's office by the end of the work week. 
- Curfew of 10:00 pm seven days a week and not out until 6:30 am unless in the company of his parents. 
- Not to apply for a passport.
